name: Homo Sapiens – The Master of Fire
effect: Gain an extra Fire energy during your elemental phase.

name: Prometheus – The Flame Bearer
effect: Once per game, draw an additional Elemental card by sacrificing an action turn.

name: Empedocles – The Philosopher of Elements
effect: Combine two Elemental cards to trigger a special reaction that increases damage.

name: Democritus – The Atomic
effect: Increase the stability of an allied Compound by revealing its hidden atomic structure.

name: Aristotle – The Naturalist
effect: Once per turn, negate the effect of an opponent's Reaction card using classical wisdom.

name: Archimedes – The Eureka Engineer
effect: Double the energy generated by your Reactions for one turn.

name: Al-Razi – The Alchemical Pioneer
effect: Transform one Elemental card into another of your choice for one turn.

name: Avicenna – The Medicinal Chemist
effect: Restore the stability of a Compound using ancient remedies.

name: Paracelsus – The Alchemical Reformer
effect: Sacrifice an Elemental card to activate a chaotic and powerful reaction.

name: Robert Boyle – The Modern Chemist
effect: Reduce the energy cost of your Compound cards for one full turn.

name: Antoine Lavoisier – The Elemental Reformer
effect: Restore the stability of all your Compounds by invoking the law of conservation.

name: Joseph Priestley – The Discoverer of Gases
effect: Add an Elemental Gas card to your hand, opening new possibilities.

name: Henry Cavendish – The Invisible Investigator
effect: Detect and remove a hidden effect from an opponent's Compound.

name: John Dalton – The Atomic Architect
effect: Reconfigure the energy cost of a Compound by assigning specific elements to it.

name: Dmitri Mendeleev – The Periodic Organizer
effect: Reorganize your deck to ensure the next card aligns with your elemental strategy.

name: Marie Curie – The Radioactive Genius
effect: Allows the use of radioactive elements without energy cost for one turn.

name: Ernest Rutherford – The Nuclear Pioneer
effect: When destroying an opponent's Compound, activate a nuclear reaction that deals extra damage.

name: Niels Bohr – The Quantum Modeler
effect: Temporarily change the energy type of an Elemental card during your turn.

name: Lise Meitner – The Nuclear Whisperer
effect: Counter an opponent's Reaction effect through a phase of nuclear decay.

name: Richard Feynman – The Quantum Explorer
effect: Once per game, activate a double Reaction phase that unpredictably alters the flow of energy.
